seo.title: How coaching works with SustainSage | ICF-aligned support
seo.description: Understand our ICF-aligned coaching partnership: session rhythm, collaboration style, and ethical boundaries.

hero.title: How coaching works
hero.subtitle: What to expect before we start: structure, partnership, and the guardrails that keep coaching ethical.

who.title: Who this is for
items: You’re curious about coaching but want clarity on process before committing.
You need to align with a partner, HR, or sponsor on what coaching covers.
You’ve worked with mentors or therapists and wonder how coaching differs.
You value cultural nuance and want to confirm we can switch between English and Chinese.

what.title: What we work on
items: Clarifying outcomes that matter to you—and how we will know progress when we see it.
Exploring perspectives, tools, and experiments that expand your options.
Designing accountability that feels supportive rather than surveillance.
Spotting systemic factors so you don’t blame yourself for structural issues.

how.title: How it works
how.description: A partnership grounded in the International Coaching Federation (ICF) core competencies.
items: Six 60-minute sessions over three to four months on Zoom, with flexibility to extend or pause.
We co-design each agenda; you bring context, we bring questions, frameworks, and reflection.
Between-session support via secure notes, Loom, or email check-ins when you request it.
Coaching is future-focused and client-led—we do not guarantee outcomes or replace legal, medical, or immigration advice.

examples.title: Example scenarios
examples.description: Composite snapshots based on real client journeys.

items.title: Navigating a cross-border promotion
items.description: We balanced stakeholder expectations across three countries, rehearsed difficult conversations, and set boundaries for a sustainable travel rhythm.

items.title: Designing a values-led pivot
items.description: A senior contributor prototyped portfolio work, refined messaging, and agreed on financial guardrails with their partner before resigning.

items.title: Re-entering after a health break
items.description: We created phased goals, coordinated with healthcare providers, and built scripts to discuss capacity without oversharing.

expect.title: What you can expect
items: Space to think and feel without judgement or forced positivity.
Clear agreements on confidentiality, boundaries, and how we will track progress.
Support naming systemic barriers alongside personal agency.
An honest partner who celebrates wins and challenges assumptions when needed.

ethics.title: Ethics & fit
items: We follow the ICF Code of Ethics, including informed consent and confidentiality.
We refer you to therapy, legal, immigration, or financial professionals when those services are more appropriate.
You always choose pace, language, and scope; we do not upsell or pressure extensions.
If the fit isn’t right, we say so and recommend alternatives when possible.

cta.title: Have more questions?
cta.body: Let’s talk through your context and decide together whether coaching is the right next step.
